Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
April 4, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of all of
the following information prior to employment or at the
time specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior
to employment from persons unrelated to the employee
and which are less than 12 months old.
Two of three new hire files reviewed had references completed after the staff
member's date of hire.
2

CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records for

performance within 30 days of the completion of the
probationary period or within 180 days, whichever is

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The CAP addressed a staff member conducting an unwarranted restraint. There
were five special investigations during the period under review and one
investigation resulted in a rule violation. CAP monitoring was conducted with the
facility. The facility has complied with the CAP.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on review of the facility's budget
and agency's financial audit.
3

PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator reported the youth at the facility can get stagnate waiting
for their next placement and sometimes that can affect the youths' behaviors. The
Chief Administrator stated there are weekly meetings with RPU that help decrease
the number of times this occurs.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported being in new roles, going through an adjustment and
learning the program. Staff stated they are working on bringing more structure to
the house which they believe will help the youth. Staff shared they receive support
from administration and feel the communication within the organization is good.
Staff reported feeling youth are provided with the services and supports they need.
Staff did not identify any concerns.
Youth interviewed reported staff do their jobs, the programing at the house is
"good," and that their needs are being met. One youth stated some of the youth in
the house get out of control, but staff redirect those youth the best they can. The
youth interviewed did not report any concerns. All youth interviewed reported
feeling safe at the facility.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on April 4, 2023.
There were no issues or safety concerns.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
